summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist regarding her duties and observations during her shift on August 10, 2019, the morning Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The interview focuses on standard operating procedures for inmate counts, door controls, and the response to the medical emergency.

persons.name: Rebekah Donaleski
persons.context: Conducted the interview of the BOP employee regarding the incident at MCC.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: Conducted the interview of the BOP employee regarding the incident at MCC.

persons.name: Omar Daza
persons.role: Office of Inspector General Special Agent
persons.context: Present for the interview of the BOP employee.

persons.name: Jestin Llewellyn
persons.context: Present for the interview and drafted the 302 report.

persons.name: Lieutenant Anderson
persons.context: Took care of the 12 o'clock inmate count on August 10, 2019, and later hit the body alarm for a medical emergency.

persons.name: CO Thomas
persons.context: Worked in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the day of the incident and was buzzed out of the SHU after EMS arrived.

persons.name: CO Nowell
persons.context: Worked in the SHU on the day of the incident, was fairly new, and the interviewee 'popped' door 46 for them so they could use the bathroom.

connections.description: Both worked in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the day of the incident.
Lieutenant Anderson was a supervisor who hit the body alarm for the medical emergency; CO Thomas was an officer working in the SHU that day.
Both were part of the team conducting the interview of the BOP employee.

events.title: Medical Emergency and Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A medical emergency occurred in the SHU at MCC, leading to the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. Lieutenant Anderson hit a body alarm at approximately 6:33 A.M., and EMS was called.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Employee
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist was interviewed by AUSAs and federal agents regarding her shift and procedures on August 10, 2019, at MCC.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The interviewee was the 'Control 1' officer during the early morning shift of August 10, 2019, when Jeffrey Epstein died.
Standard procedure involved 30-minute rounds and head counts at 12:00, 3:00, and 5:00 A.M.; the SHU count was reported as '72' and was accurate.
The video feed for the SHU range was not operational, so the control officer could only see the officers at the desk, not the rest of the range.
Lieutenant Anderson hit a body alarm for a medical emergency at approximately 6:33 A.M., prompting an immediate 911 call for EMS.
Door '46' was 'popped' for CO Nowell to use the bathroom on 10 South, as there was no elevator between 9 South and 10 South in the SHU.
